description: Compare Scots stramash. Possibly related to Hindi तमाशा (tamāśā) or Italian stramazzone.

examples: Then more calling , and bawling, And squalling , and falling , Oh ! what a fearful stramash they are all in !

verbs.description: stramash (third-person singular simple present stramashes, present participle stramashing, simple past and past participle stramashed)

entries.meaning: (Yorkshire, dialect) To make a noise, to cause an uproar, to cause a disturbance
(Scotland, dialect) To strike, beat, or bang; to break; to destroy.
